meanings.definition: The policy or practice of acquiring full or partial political control over another country, occupying it with settlers, and exploiting it economically.
meanings.sent1: The colonialisms of the past led to significant changes in many nations.
meanings.sent2: The history books often discuss the impact of colonialisms on indigenous populations.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to learn about the colonialisms of their ancestors in school.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of colonialisms still lingers in the economic structures of some countries.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit vividly portrayed the harsh realities of colonialisms.

meanings.definition: The system or policy by which a country maintains colonies.
meanings.sent1: The colonialisms of the British Empire were vast and far-reaching.
meanings.sent2: Many debates center around the ethics of colonialisms in modern times.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed a fictional world where colonialisms were reversed.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, fierce competition can sometimes feel like colonialisms.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the complexities of colonialisms throughout history.
